channel.title: Multiple Linear Regression on Amit Rajan
channel.description: Recent content in Multiple Linear Regression on Amit Rajan

item.title: ISLR Chapter 3: Linear Regression (Part 2: Multiple Linear Regression)
item.description: 3.2 Multiple Linear Regression In general, suppose we have $p$ distinct predictors, the multiple linear regression takes the form: $$Y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 X_1 + \beta_2 X_2 + … + \beta_p X_p + \epsilon$$ where $\beta_j$ can be interpreted as the average effect on $Y$ of a one unit increase in $X_j$, holding all other predictors fixed. 3.2.1 Estimating the Regression Coefficients Given the estimates, $\widehat{\beta_0}, \widehat{\beta_1},…, \widehat{\beta_p}$, predictions can be done as:
